Bases: object

Distributes elements from DataBatch to corresponding handlers for further processing.

Storage of measurements.

“Sensor -> handlers” tables.

Initializes “sensor -> handlers” table.

Parameters:

table_config – table with “sensor name -> handlers names” pairs.

Removes the given data from the measurements storage.

Parameters:

data – data to be removed from storage.

Distributes the element to the handler for further processing.

class moduslam.frontend_manager.frontend_manager.FrontendManager(config: FrontendManagerConfig)[source]

Bases: object

Manages all frontend procedures:

  • processes measurements

  • builds graph

Parameters:

config – frontend manager configuration.

Sets prior factors to the graph.

create_graph(batch: DataBatch) → None[source]

Creates main graph by merging sub-graphs (graph candidates).

Parameters:

batch – data batch with elements.

moduslam.frontend_manager.measurement_storage module

class moduslam.frontend_manager.measurement_storage.Measurement(time_range: TimeRange, value: Any, handler: Handler, elements: tuple[Element, ...], noise_covariance: tuple)[source]

Bases: object

A measurement formed of processed element(s) by the corresponding handler.

Hash calculation ignores “values” attribute because not all values are hashable.

time_range: TimeRange
value: Any
handler: Handler
elements: tuple[Element, ...]
noise_covariance: tuple
class moduslam.frontend_manager.measurement_storage.MeasurementStorage[source]

Bases: object

Storage for measurements.

property data: dict[Handler, OrderedSet[Measurement]]

Dictionary with “handler -> measurements” pairs.

property recent_measurement: Measurement

A measurement with latest “stop” timestamp in the storage.

Raises:

EmptyStorageError – recent measurement does not exist in empty storage.

property time_range: TimeRange

Start & stop time margins to cover all measurements in the storage.

Raises:

IndexError – time range does not exist for empty storage.

property empty: bool

Checks if the storage is empty.

add(measurement: Measurement | Iterable[Measurement]) → None[source]

Adds measurement(s) to the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – measurement(s) to add.

remove(measurement: Measurement | Iterable[Measurement]) → None[source]

Removes the measurement(s) from the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – the measurement(s) to be removed.

clear() → None[source]

Clears the storage.

_add(measurement: Measurement) → None[source]

Adds new measurement(s) to the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – the measurement to add.

_remove(measurement: Measurement) → None[source]

Removes the measurement from the storage.

Parameters:

measurement – the measurement to remove.

_update_recent_measurement(measurement: Measurement) → None[source]

Updates the recent measurement in the storage by comparing the “stop” timestamp of measurement`s time range.

Parameters:

measurement – new measurement to compare with.

_update_time_range(time_range: TimeRange) → None[source]

Updates the time range of the storage.

Parameters:

time_range – time range to update.

_find_recent_measurement() → Measurement | None[source]

Finds the measurement with the latest “stop” timestamp in the storage.

_update_time_range_all() → None[source]

Updates the time range of the storage for all measurements.

moduslam.frontend_manager.noise_models module

moduslam.frontend_manager.noise_models.position_diagonal_noise_model(noise_variances: tuple[float, float, float]) → Variances[source]

Diagonal Gaussian noise model for position: [x, y, z].

Parameters:

noise_variances – tuple of 3 floats representing the variances of the noise.

Returns:

gtsam noise model.

moduslam.frontend_manager.noise_models.pose_isotropic_noise_model(variance: float) → Variance[source]

Isotropic Gaussian noise model for pose: [x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw].

Parameters:

variance – float representing the standard deviation of the noise.

Returns:

gtsam noise model.

moduslam.frontend_manager.noise_models.pose_diagonal_noise_model(noise_variances: tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float]) → Variances[source]

Diagonal Gaussian noise model for pose: [x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw].

Parameters:

noise_variances – tuple of 6 floats representing the variances of the noise.

Returns:

gtsam noise model.

moduslam.frontend_manager.noise_models.pixel_diagonal_noise_model(noise_variances: tuple[float, float]) → Variances[source]

Diagonal Gaussian noise model for pixel: [u, v].

Parameters:

noise_variances – tuple of 2 floats representing the variances of the noise.

Returns:

gtsam noise model.
